VLIB_histogram_1D_U8

Detailed Description


Functions

int32_t VLIB_histogram_1D_U8 (const uint8_t *restrict X, const int32_t numX, const int32_t numBins, const uint16_t binWeight, const uint8_t *restrict histArray, uint16_t *restrict H1, uint16_t *restrict H2, uint16_t *restrict H3, uint16_t *restrict H)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_histogram_1D_U8 ( const uint8_t *restrict  X,
const int32_t  numX,
const int32_t  numBins,
const uint16_t  binWeight,
const uint8_t *restrict  histArray,
uint16_t *restrict  H1,
uint16_t *restrict  H2,
uint16_t *restrict  H3,
uint16_t *restrict  H 
)

Description
Computes histogram from array of 8-bit unsigned integers using user-specified bins.
Parameters:
[in] *X Input array of scalar (UQ8.0)
[in] numX Number of elements in X (SQ31.0)
[in] numBins Number of bins (SQ31.0)
[in] binWeight Value to accumulate in histogram bins (UQ16.0)
[in] *histArray Array for internal use, initialized by VLIB_histogram_1D_Init_U8 (UQ8.0)
[in] *H1 Array for internal use (UQ16.0)
[in] *H2 Array for internal use (UQ16.0)
[in] *H3 Array for internal use (UQ16.0)
[in,out] *H Array to hold the computed histogram (UQ16.0)
Assumptions
  • histArray should be initialized by calling VLIB_histogram_1D_Init_U8.
  • H[k] will hold the number of elements that satisfy the following equation:
    • binEdges[k] <= X[i] < binEdges[k+1] (for k=0 .. numBins-2)
  • The last bin H[numBins-1] will hold the number of elements that satisfy the following equation:
    • X[i] == binEdges[numBins-1]
  • All values below binEdges[0] and above binEdges[numBins-1] will not be accumulated in any of the bins.
  • numX should be a multiple of 4
  • numBins should be a multiple of 2 (histArray can be formed with a non-multiple of 2, but the H buffers should be sized according to numBins)
  • H, H1, H2, and H3 should be of length numBins (multiple of 2), initialized to 0.
  • X, H, H1, H2, and H3 should all be 4 byte aligned
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
